title: The WAR to Settle the SCORES
body_text:
DODGEBALL 116 & 117 Announcements!
The colossal six-pack challenge if you will isn't the only thing to anticipate - the main events for both the 116th spectacular and second annual Christmas Special will be made public!
Butler Beat Box!
So on the agenda are the bombshell announements as well as the huge team attraction ... but also, a high-octance soundtrack created just for CXV by the legendary,
Gold Award
nominee, Michael Butler!
LONDONO, MARZARELLA, FITZPATRICK
vs. AVAKIAN, BASISTA, C. ADAMS
Mid-Season Main Event:
"The War to Settle the Scores"
This is just huge! Literally, figuratively one of the biggest wars in all of dodgeball history!
LONDONO / AVAKIAN History
Coming off the heels of a six month conflict with the legendary Tom Adams, "Muffin Man" Juan Londono begged to find where his career would take him next. As DODGEBALL 96 approached, an opportunity presented itself with the returning
Hit the Human
contest - and the challenge of the suicidal Rob Avakian. The somewhat forgotten pregame set the stage for one of the most intense wars of the year!
On that
July 14
night, Avakian successfully fought off the Londono-lead charges in a truly magical showcase. "The Cockroach" would have to wait until
DODGEBALL 106
- an agonizing three months - before his next shot and ultimately return the favor.
MARZARELLA / BASISTA History
You've heard it once, you'll hear it again - "In Lieu of Lenny!" Unable to attend, the award-winning Herrera left rookie-of-the-year contender Sascha Basista without competition in the proposed contest at
DODGEBALL 84
. With the sudden void, willing combatants teed off in a rare
Rimshot Contest
to decide the evening's headliners.
PondScum
icon Ray Marzarella wound up the sole survivor in the pregame festivity and the rest is history.
That battle between the "Reckless One" and the blocking extraordinaire went unresolved in the inaugural bout with each man racking two wins. But the conflict doesn't cease there.
In their destined rematch, Basista bested the gutsy opposition at
DODGEBALL NINETY 4
in front of an astounding 39 at the June 2007 finale. But before long, Marzarella extracted his own measure of revenge, joining forces with
PondScum
ally Gerald "G Money" Lewis and dismantling the breakdancing dodger along with the colorful Joey Smalls in an unforgettable doubles bout in
early-September
.
FITZPATRICK / ADAMS History
The unforgiving struggle that revolutionized the so-called "captains match". It's hard to believe it's been nearly one full year since these two first clashed at the 2006 year-end finale, DODGEBALL 70, and even now, nothing has been settled! Each tied at 1, this six-man collision may once and for all put a stop to this sadistic massacre.
To recap, Fitzpatrick annihilated the eldest Adams into oblivian at the
Season 7 finale
late last year. But how the tables had turned and "Fitz", in their impatiently-awaited return brawl was left "blinded by the white"; "The Axe" Adams had defeated his nemisis in the
CREAMation 3
.
This is the fifth* prearranged match between the superpowers and records clearly show no favorite heading into this "War to Settle to Scores".
*See
DODGEBALL 75
and
DODGEBALL 101
.........
Already in this 12th Season:
DODGEBALL CX1: Kevin Adams defeated Grant Cornero in a DODGEBALL LXXXVI rematch
DODGEBALL CX2: Mike Edwards remains unbeaten with a win over Derek Carty
DODGEBALL CX3: Wall decimates All in the feverishly-awaited fourth round
DODGEBALL 114: Pam D'Luhy in her debut match knocks off Valerie Winston
The insanity of Avakian and Basista, the uncanny power of Adams and Fitzpatrick, the never-say-die attitudes of Londono and Marzarella ... brace yourself for the kick-ass, in-your-face action as only these six warriors know how. The mid-season main event will deliver!
body_html:
DODGEBALL 116 & 117 Announcements!
The colossal six-pack challenge if you will isn't the only thing to anticipate - the main events for both the 116th spectacular and second annual Christmas Special will be made public!

Butler Beat Box!
So on the agenda are the bombshell announements as well as the huge team attraction ... but also, a high-octance soundtrack created just for CXV by the legendary, Gold Award nominee, Michael Butler!

LONDONO, MARZARELLA, FITZPATRICK
vs. AVAKIAN, BASISTA, C. ADAMS
Mid-Season Main Event: "The War to Settle the Scores"

This is just huge! Literally, figuratively one of the biggest wars in all of dodgeball history!

LONDONO / AVAKIAN History
Coming off the heels of a six month conflict with the legendary Tom Adams, "Muffin Man" Juan Londono begged to find where his career would take him next. As DODGEBALL 96 approached, an opportunity presented itself with the returning Hit the Human contest - and the challenge of the suicidal Rob Avakian. The somewhat forgotten pregame set the stage for one of the most intense wars of the year!

On that July 14 night, Avakian successfully fought off the Londono-lead charges in a truly magical showcase. "The Cockroach" would have to wait until DODGEBALL 106 - an agonizing three months - before his next shot and ultimately return the favor.

MARZARELLA / BASISTA History
You've heard it once, you'll hear it again - "In Lieu of Lenny!" Unable to attend, the award-winning Herrera left rookie-of-the-year contender Sascha Basista without competition in the proposed contest at DODGEBALL 84. With the sudden void, willing combatants teed off in a rare Rimshot Contest to decide the evening's headliners. PondScum icon Ray Marzarella wound up the sole survivor in the pregame festivity and the rest is history.

That battle between the "Reckless One" and the blocking extraordinaire went unresolved in the inaugural bout with each man racking two wins. But the conflict doesn't cease there.

In their destined rematch, Basista bested the gutsy opposition at DODGEBALL NINETY 4 in front of an astounding 39 at the June 2007 finale. But before long, Marzarella extracted his own measure of revenge, joining forces with PondScum ally Gerald "G Money" Lewis and dismantling the breakdancing dodger along with the colorful Joey Smalls in an unforgettable doubles bout in early-September.

FITZPATRICK / ADAMS History
The unforgiving struggle that revolutionized the so-called "captains match". It's hard to believe it's been nearly one full year since these two first clashed at the 2006 year-end finale, DODGEBALL 70, and even now, nothing has been settled! Each tied at 1, this six-man collision may once and for all put a stop to this sadistic massacre.

To recap, Fitzpatrick annihilated the eldest Adams into oblivian at the Season 7 finale late last year. But how the tables had turned and "Fitz", in their impatiently-awaited return brawl was left "blinded by the white"; "The Axe" Adams had defeated his nemisis in the CREAMation 3.

This is the fifth* prearranged match between the superpowers and records clearly show no favorite heading into this "War to Settle to Scores".
*See DODGEBALL 75 and DODGEBALL 101

.........

Already in this 12th Season:
DODGEBALL CX1: Kevin Adams defeated Grant Cornero in a DODGEBALL LXXXVI rematch
DODGEBALL CX2: Mike Edwards remains unbeaten with a win over Derek Carty
DODGEBALL CX3: Wall decimates All in the feverishly-awaited fourth round
DODGEBALL 114: Pam D'Luhy in her debut match knocks off Valerie Winston

The insanity of Avakian and Basista, the uncanny power of Adams and Fitzpatrick, the never-say-die attitudes of Londono and Marzarella ... brace yourself for the kick-ass, in-your-face action as only these six warriors know how. The mid-season main event will deliver!
